summary: The Stop Foreign Propaganda Act aims to impose sanctions on individuals or entities knowingly providing media services or material support to sanctioned foreign propaganda outlets. The bill codifies Executive Order 13846 regarding Iran sanctions, mandates sanctions against those providing services to covered foreign media entities, and requires the President to waive sanctions under certain conditions. It also mandates a report to Congress detailing such activities, enforcement actions and an assessment of Iranian influence operations. The bill defines key terms like "foreign media entity" and "material support or media services."
